text: Eʋegbe me, serial verb construction wɔ ne sia sia a verb evewo alo geɖe ɖe woɖe sentence ɖeka me, eye mekpɔ ame si wɔ kpɔkpɔɖeŋu le verbawo dome o.
translation: In Ewe, a serial verb construction consists of two or more verbs occurring in a single clause without a conjunction between them.

text: Wɔ Eʋegbe me no, serial verbawo wɔ sentence ɖeka me le tense kple aspect si woɖe ɖeka si wotsɔ ɖe verbawo katã dzi.
translation: In Ewe, all verbs in a serial verb construction share the same tense and aspect marking.

text: Serial verb construction le Eʋegbe me kɔ asɛmɖeɖe si verbawo kɔɖeɖe le sentence ɖeka me eye wotsɔ wo kɔ ɖe asɛm ɖeka ƒe nuwɔwɔ.
translation: In Ewe, serial verb constructions are used to express actions in which verbs occur together in one sentence to describe one situation.

text: Eʋegbe me, aspect mekpɔ nu ɖeka kple tense o; aspect tsɔ gomeɖeɖeɖe si asɛm le wɔwɔwɔ me alo nu si wowɔ vɔ.
translation: In Ewe, aspect is distinct from tense and indicates whether an action is in progress or has been completed.

text: Le sukuwɔnu si wotsɔ fia le Eʋegbe kɔkɔeawo me la, aspect marker le verb la ŋgɔ alo megbe, sɛ́nea wotsɔ kɔ asɛm la ƒe gomeɖeɖeɖe.
translation: In the lesson examples, aspect markers occur before or after the verb as shown.
